      <hr/>
      <p style="text-align:center">
       <font face="Times New Roman" size="3">
       </font>
       <font face="Times New Roman" size="3">
        <a href="http://www.firstladies.org/founder.aspx">
         <img src="/images/Mary-Regula(1)R.jpg" style="width:217px;height:320px"/>
        </a>
       </font>
      </p>
      <p style="text-align:center">
       <font face="Times New Roman" size="3">
        <img alt="" src="/images/In Memoriam Dark.jpg" style="width:147px;height:75px"/>
       </font>
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
         The trustees and staff of the National First Ladies’ Library are profoundly saddened by the passing of our President Emerita and founder, Mary A. Regula.  The National First Ladies’ Library was made possible through her dedication and strong leadership.  Mary’s enthusiasm and drive for the preservation of the legacy of all First Ladies was contagious.
        </span>
       </strong>
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
         Mary Regula led the National First Ladies’ Library with unparalleled commitment and grace. Mary’s enormous and indelible presence will be missed by friends and family here in Canton, but also by those who met her on her crusade to educate the public and preserve the legacy of the First Ladies of the United States.
        </span>
       </strong>
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
         Our love, thoughts and prayers go to David, Martha and Richard, and to all the Regula family, as they say their final goodbyes to Mary.
        </span>
       </strong>
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        <span style="background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
         William Blair, National First Ladies’ Library Board Chair's thoughts on Mary Regula::
        </span>
       </strong>
      </p>
      <p>
       <em>
        <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
         I learned, with great sadness of the passing of Mary
Regula. As the
        </span>
       </em>
       <em>
        <span style="color:#254061;font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
         Board Chair of the National First
Ladies’ Library, the institution she created and led until a few years ago but
remained as Founding President until her death, it is of course, a great
loss.  For myself I have lost a friend and mentor whom I have known for
most of my life. Mary was proud to be a strong woman who spent her life in an
age when women’s accomplishments were undervalued at best, or not recognized at
worst. This was the impetus for the creation of the National First Ladies’
Library as the foremost research institution on the lives of the First Ladies,
who had lasting impact on this country, much of which was behind the scenes.
The subcontext of this was to recognize the great achievements of all women
who, similarly have not been recognized for their achievements.
        </span>
       </em>
      </p>
      <p>
       <em>
        <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
         Mary was a great partner to her husband, Ralph,  in
every sense of the word.  They lived their lives as a couple deeply in
love and dedicated to making the world a better place for us all, in every way
they could.  Mary and Ralph represented a rapidly disappearing way of
conduct in public and private that was thoroughly decent without hate or rancor.
        </span>
       </em>
      </p>
      <p>
       <em>
        <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
        </span>
       </em>
       <em>
        <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
        </span>
       </em>
       <em>
        <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
        </span>
       </em>
       <em>
        <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
        </span>
       </em>
       <em>
        <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
        </span>
       </em>
       <em>
        <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
         <u5:p>
         </u5:p>
        </span>
       </em>
      </p>
      <p>
       <em>
        <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
         Mary was a loving mother to her children David, Martha
and Richard.  To them and their families we extend our deepest sympathies.
We are all much richer for her life and much poorer for her passing.
        </span>
       </em>
      </p>
      <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
      </span>
      <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
      </span>
      <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
      </span>
      <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
      </span>
      <p>
      </p>
      <p style="background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial">
       <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
        <strong>
         Craig Kenkel, National Park Service, Superintendent,  Cuyahoga Valley National Park, First Ladies National Historic Site, and James A. Garfield National Historic Site
        </strong>
       </span>
      </p>
      <em>
       <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
        The National Park Service would like to express condolences and profound gratefulness to the family of Mary A. Regula.  It is because of her visionary work that the First Ladies National
       </span>
       <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
        Historic Site exists to tell the stories of remarkable women who made important contributions to our
       </span>
       <span style="font-family:Georgia;font-size:16px">
        nation's history.
       </span>
      </em>
      <p>
       <i>
       </i>
       <a href="http://www.firstladies.org/founder.aspx">
        <strong>
         Click Here for More Information
        </strong>
       </a>
       <br/>
      </p>
      <hr/>
      <span style="text-decoration:underline;font-size:24px">
       <strong>
        First Lady, Barbara Bush  -
       </strong>
       <strong>
        1925 - 2018
       </strong>
      </span>
     </div>
     <p style="margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1d2129;text-align:center">
      <strong>
       <a href="http://www.firstladies.org/biographies/firstladies.aspx?biography=42">
        <img alt="" src="/images/Barbara BushR.jpg" style="width:212px;height:278px;float:left"/>
       </a>
       The board and staff of the National First Ladies' Library are deeply sorry to hear of the passing of former First Lady Barbara Bush. We will always be grateful for the strong support of our organization by Mrs. Bush and the Bush family.
      </strong>
     </p>
     <p style="margin: 6px 0px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1d2129;text-align:center">
      <strong>
       Dubbed the "silver fox", Mrs. Bush was known for her tough, no-nonsense approach as well as for her charm and quick wit, which made her widely popular. The American public found her outspoken perspective refreshing.
      </strong>
     </p>
     <p style="margin: 6px 0px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1d2129;text-align:center">
      <strong>
       Only the second woman to
      </strong>
      <strong>
       <span class="text_exposed_show" style=" font-family: inherit">
        be wife of one President and mother to another, Mrs. Bush was a down-to-earth strong matriarch and was widely acknowledged as the rock of the Bush family.
       </span>
      </strong>
     </p>
     <div class="text_exposed_show" style=" font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1d2129">
      <p style="margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: inherit;text-align:center">
       <strong>
        Mrs. Bush was a determined advocate of family literacy and of women's rights. The Barbara Bush Foundation for Family Literacy will stand as a cornerstone of her legacy.
       </strong>
      </p>
     </div>
     <p style="text-align:center">
      <strong>
       <span style="font-family: inherit; color: #1d2129">
        We extend our sincere sympathies to the Bush family.
       </span>
      </strong>
      <strong>
      </strong>
     </p>
     <hr/>

      <tr>
